application.doc: Retrieve the trace file snippet for a trace component

param.name: id
param.doc: Name of the instance to act on, which is a unique name that identifies the instance

param.name: trace_id
param.doc: The name of the trace component

param.name: trace_file_id
param.doc: The name of the trace file

param.name: size
param.doc: The number of lines to retrieve from the file. This parameter is optional and will be set to 100 if not specified. The maximum size that can be returned is 214800000 lines. If a size greater than that is specified, then the maximum (214800000 lines) is returned.

param.name: options
param.doc: Any options that are required for the snippet output. Accepted value is options=line_numbers, which include line numbers in the snippet output. This parameter is optional.

param.name: start
param.doc: The line number to start the snippet retrieval from. If specified the snippet will be retrieved counting forward from this line. This parameter is optional and if not specified the snippet will be retrieved counting back from the end of the file.

method.name: GET
method.id: Retrieve trace file snippet - Authorization Server
method.doc: This web service will retrieve a snippet of the trace file for a specified trace component and authorization server instance. The snippet size and orientation is configurable. By default the snippet is 100 lines and is retrieved from the end of the log file.

param.name: Accept:application/json
param.doc: Required for requests to the service

response.doc:
200 ok
{"contents":"The last line of the trace file"}

param.name: contents
param.doc: The contents of the trace file snippet.

response.doc: There is a problem with the request. The JSON message describes the problem.
File not Found, The requested service does not exist. The JSON message indicates which resource.
An internal error occurred. The JSON message indicates the problem.
